description: From Ancient Greek πνεῦμα (pneûma) (breath) and ὁδός (hodós) (pathway)

entries.meaning: (botany, histology) A group of cells with spiral secondary wall thickenings, present in a velamen; acts as an airway for gas exchange for respiration or photosynthesis
(botany, histology) A group of cells presumed to be specialised as an airway for ventilation of particular tissues.
